sanskrit:
कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन।
मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि॥
translation: You have a right to perform your prescribed duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits of your actions.
explanation: This verse teaches the principle of detached action - focus on your duty without attachment to results.

sanskrit:
यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत।
अभ्युत्थानमधर्मस्य तदाऽअत्मानं सृजाम्यहम्॥
translation: Whenever there is a decline in righteousness and an increase in unrighteousness, O Arjuna, at that time I manifest Myself on earth.
explanation: Lord Krishna assures that divine intervention occurs whenever dharma is in danger.

sanskrit:
परित्राणाय साधूनां विनाशाय च दुष्कृताम्।
धर्मसंस्थापनार्थाय सम्भवामि युगे युगे॥
translation: To protect the righteous, to annihilate the wicked, and to reestablish dharma, I appear millennium after millennium.
explanation: God's incarnation is to maintain balance in the universe by supporting righteousness.

sanskrit:
देहिनोऽस्मिन्यथा देहे कौमारं यौवनं जरा।
तथा देहान्तरप्राप्तिर्धीरस्तत्र न मुह्यति॥
translation: Just as the boyhood, youth and old age come to the embodied Soul in this body, in the same manner, is the attaining of another body; the wise man is not deluded at that.
explanation: Krishna teaches about the soul's immortality and the natural process of rebirth.

sanskrit:
सर्वधर्मान्परित्यज्य मामेकं शरणं व्रज।
अहं त्वां सर्वपापेभ्यो मोक्षयिष्यामि मा शुचः॥
translation: Abandon all varieties of religion and just surrender unto Me. I shall deliver you from all sinful reactions. Do not fear.
explanation: This is one of the most important verses, emphasizing complete surrender to the Divine.

sanskrit:
न जायते म्रियते वा कदाचित् नायं भूत्वा भविता वा न भूयः।
अजो नित्यः शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणो न हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे॥
translation: The soul is neither born, and nor does it die. It has not come into being, does not come into being, and will not come into being.
explanation: This shloka emphasizes the immortality of the soul—it cannot be killed or destroyed.

sanskrit:
वासांसि जीर्णानि यथा विहाय
नवानि गृह्णाति नरोऽपराणि।
तथा शरीराणि विहाय जीर्णा-
न्यन्यानि संयाति नवानि देही॥
translation: As a person sheds worn-out garments and puts on new ones, so does the soul cast off its worn-out bodies and enter new ones.
explanation: Krishna explains reincarnation using the metaphor of changing clothes.

sanskrit:
एवं प्रवर्तितं चक्रं नानुवर्तयतीह यः।
अघायुरिन्द्रियारामो मोघं पार्थ स जीवति॥
translation: He who does not follow the wheel of creation set in motion lives in vain, O Arjuna.
explanation: Neglecting duties and living only for senses leads to a wasted life.

sanskrit:
यद्यदाचरति श्रेष्ठस्तत्तदेवेतरो जनः।
स यत्प्रमाणं कुरुते लोकस्तदनुवर्तते॥
translation: Whatever a great man does, others follow. The standard he sets is followed by the world.
explanation: Leaders influence society through their actions; responsibility comes with position.

sanskrit:
चातुर्वर्ण्यं मया सृष्टं गुणकर्मविभागशः।
तस्य कर्तारमपि मां विद्ध्यकर्तारमव्ययम्॥
translation: The fourfold division of society was created by Me based on qualities and work.
explanation: Caste is based on nature and action, not birth.

sanskrit:
तद्विद्धि प्रणिपातेन परिप्रश्नेन सेवया।
उपदेक्ष्यन्ति ते ज्ञानं ज्ञानिनस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः॥
translation: Approach the wise with humility, inquiry, and service. They will impart knowledge to you.
explanation: True knowledge comes through humility, curiosity, and service to the wise.

sanskrit:
विद्याविनयसम्पन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि।
शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिताः समदर्शिनः॥
translation: The wise see with equal vision a learned Brahmin, a cow, an elephant, a dog, and a dog-eater.
explanation: True wisdom leads to seeing all beings with equality and respect.

sanskrit:
उद्धरेदात्मनाऽत्मानं नाऽऽत्मानमवसादयेत्।
आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः॥
translation: Elevate yourself through your own efforts. Don’t degrade yourself. You are your own friend or enemy.
explanation: Self-mastery is the key to growth; your mind is your best friend or worst enemy.

sanskrit:
बन्धुरात्माऽत्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः।
अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत्॥
translation: For one who has conquered the mind, the mind is the best friend. For the uncontrolled, it acts as an enemy.
explanation: Mastery over the mind leads to inner peace; otherwise, it causes suffering.

sanskrit:
यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम्।
ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत्॥
translation: Wherever the mind wanders, bring it back under the control of the Self.
explanation: Discipline the mind gently and repeatedly to achieve inner focus.

sanskrit:
चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन।
आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ॥
translation: Four kinds of virtuous people worship Me: the distressed, the seekers of knowledge, the seekers of wealth, and the wise.
explanation: Different people approach God for different reasons, all are blessed.

sanskrit:
अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते।
तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम्॥
translation: To those who worship Me with exclusive devotion, I take care of their needs and safety.
explanation: Complete surrender ensures divine protection and support.

sanskrit:
समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः।
ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम्॥
translation: I am equal to all beings; none is hateful or dear to Me. But those who worship Me with devotion are in Me, and I am in them.
explanation: God sees all equally but responds specially to devotion.

sanskrit:
अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः।
अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च॥
translation: I am the Self, O Arjuna, seated in the hearts of all creatures. I am the beginning, the middle and the end of all beings.
explanation: Krishna identifies Himself as the indwelling self in all beings.

sanskrit:
अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते।
इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः॥
translation: I am the source of all creation. Knowing this, the wise worship Me with loving devotion.
explanation: Recognition of the divine origin of all fuels devotion.

sanskrit:
अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च।
निर्ममो निरहंकारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी॥
translation: One who is free from malice, friendly, compassionate, and balanced in pain and pleasure, is dear to Me.
explanation: Divine qualities are rooted in love, humility, and patience.

sanskrit:
यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च यः।
हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः॥
translation: He who neither agitates others nor gets agitated by them, who is free from excitement, envy, fear, and anxiety, is very dear to Me.
explanation: Calmness and composure are signs of spiritual maturity.

sanskrit:
मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते।
स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते॥
translation: He who serves Me with unwavering devotion transcends the gunas and becomes fit for Brahman.
explanation: Devotion leads to transcendence of material qualities.

sanskrit:
ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूतः सनातनः।
मनःषष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति॥
translation: The living beings in this conditioned world are My eternal fragmental parts.
explanation: Every soul is a divine spark, influenced by mind and senses.
